intro: Perantha cordatula, commonly known as the heartleaf perantha, is a small flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Perantha cordatula thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant communities and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
